name: places/ChIJebBhOBn2wokRd6x2tX8piWI
formattedAddress: Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Urban aquatic center featuring a sizable swimming pool, open from late June to early September.

originalText.text: *Edit: Finally made it in! Definitely bring the thickest lock you have. At times it feels like you need security papers or clearance to get in, and their rules seem a bit goofy at times, but it IS free and it IS public, so that’s understandable. The pool is very refreshing and well-looked after, just be weary of the massive line it attracts later in the day, as seen in the photo. Head over early and hope no one else has the same idea!

originalText.text: So disappointed to see that this pool has been closed down after years of service to the northern Manhattan community. There’s a heat wave next week and New Yorkers have limited ways to cool down! Found out through extensive research that the Central Park Conservancy is doing a $160 million dollar restoration of this city pool to make it smaller! Gentrification machines are the worst. We deserve fully funded & fully public recreational spaces for all! The pool is not set to reopen until at least 2024. Guess the community will just have to endure 90 degree summer days without any relief...and then deal with increased rents when the smaller pool opens in 5 years!

originalText.text: This is one of my favorite pools in New York city. It is just under four feet deep and there is more than enough room for everyone of all ages to enjoy themselves.  Very well staffed with life guards, attendants and NYPD. No drama just family fun. If you don't want to go during the general sessions adults can do lap swim at 7 am or 7 pm

originalText.text: Great huge pool but know the rules! You MUST bring a lock and a towel or they won’t let you in. Locker rooms and bathrooms are pretty gross but pool is enormous and beautiful so it’s worth it. Even when it’s crowded you can always find a part of the pool to enjoy. Lap swimming early morning and late night is fantastic but register online in advance.

originalText.text: I visited this summer. Way too crowded. Rude people who push past you in the pool. Guess this is not their fault but they should lessen the amount of people in the pool at a given time. I have never liked the NYC Parks and Rec Dept in general because they have weirdly specific and strict rules, such as requiring you to have a lock. If you're dumb enough to not lock up your stuff that should be on you.
